Hey Trey, Congratulations on the new leadership role.  It's sure to be a lot of work.  From what I've seen you're ready to take it on
But ... don't leave this AbID behind.  We are working on labels but need the barcode file return from the AbID process to make it go.  Catalogers have been working so there's stuff for Mike to apply the new processes to.

@doncat I assure you nothing's been forgotten. I'm hoping to have something pushed up for y'all to try out on Monday. In the meantime here's a demo of where we're at:

https://vimeo.com/592921471

dspace-development.title: Test and ensure that PeopleSoft HR feeds can be imported into Elements

comments.body:
Currently, this should be achieved by attempting to invoke the following from the PowerShell:

```ps
 PS C:\Users\[$USER]> & 'D:\Symplectic\Elements\StandardHRImporter\Symplectic.StandardHRImporter.exe' 
```

This should update the file located at the following path ` D:\Symplectic\HR File\Princeton_HR_Export_Symplectic_Format.csv`. However, currently the following is found:

```ps
 2021-08-26 15:15:58:	CSV reader opened on file D:\Symplectic\HR File\Princeton_HR_Export_Symplectic_Format.csv
2021-08-26 15:15:58:	Elements api base url set to: https://[$HOST]:9002/secure-api
2021-08-26 15:15:59:	1361 HR records read into memory.
2021-08-26 15:15:59:	Performing user clear down for feed : 1
2021-08-26 15:15:59:	Unable to perfom user cleardown.
2021-08-26 15:15:59:	No response was received from the server at the endpoint https://[$HOST]:9002/secure-api/user-feeds/1
.
2021-08-26 15:15:59:	CSV reader closed for file D:\Symplectic\HR File\Princeton_HR_Export_Symplectic_Format.csv.
***Exeption in program - see error log***
2021-08-26 15:15:59:	Mail from Elements HR Importer <elements@organisation.ac.uk> to mail@mail.com with subject Error Occured During Elements HR Import Feed
2021-08-26 15:15:59:		Using SSL connection
2021-08-26 15:15:59:		Using SMTP port (25)
2021-08-26 15:15:59:		Connecting to the SMTP server using username=username and password
2021-08-26 15:15:59:	SMTP connection error, please supply correct SMTP server address and access credentials : Failure sending mail.
2021-08-26 15:15:59:	Exiting... 
```

Attempting to open port 9002 using the user interface for Elements was not, alone, sufficient:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1443986/131025305-f467b66b-d10b-4758-bdef-7398b95af907.png)

orangelight.title: Enhance Accession field display on show page for numismatics

comments.body:
How do we know if it is an accession?
How do we know if it is a donor?

@eliotjordan It looks like the accession number and person name are two fields available on accessions in Figgy.  They'd need to be indexed into Orangelight as two separate fields, I'm guessing, and have "accession number" and "gift of" prepended in the display there.   Is that accurate, or would you recommend a different approach?

@christinach They are all accessions and some of them are gifts as indicated by the type property.

The value that is indexed into OL is generated in the accession decorator. You should be able to add additional text and prepend "gift of" in this method:

https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/blob/main/app/resources/numismatics/accessions/numismatics/accession_decorator.rb#L65

Document Builder:
https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/blob/main/app/resources/numismatics/coins/orangelight_coin_builder.rb#L65

orangelight.title: Display long-form reference values for numismatics

comments.body: I dont see this information in the orangelight document. Do we need to add more information in figgy?

@eliotjordan Would we just pull the full figgy_title value from the Reference in Figgy into Orangelight instead of the short value?  For the example coin above, that would be "Price, Martin Jessop Price, The Coinage in the Name of Alexander the Great and Philip Arrhidaeus: A British Museum Catalogue, 1991" which doesn't match the example text that Alan provided, but I don't see another place where we could get a value like what Alan is suggesting.  Is there one?

The text for the reference is pulled from the citation decorator:
https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/blob/main/app/resources/numismatics/issues/numismatics/issue_decorator.rb#L77

You can make changes there:
https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/blob/main/app/resources/numismatics/citations/numismatics/citation_decorator.rb#L32

Use the full title instead of the short title:
```
"#{decorated_numismatic_reference&.title} #{part} #{number}"
```

See also:
https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/blob/main/app/resources/numismatics/coins/orangelight_coin_builder.rb#L110

Also, at the moment, only issue references are included (that was the initial request from Alan when we started this work). We might want to add coin references as well in combined field. That might be a separate ticket, though.

orangelight.title: Move to instance methods in PhysicalHoldingsMarkupBuilder
Requests buttons showing when items are 3 hour reserves

comments.body:
We did some work to remove the Request button for Reserve items in PR #2576. 

But it seems that the logic is not kicking in because the items are being NOT reported on-reserve in Alma. For example, https://catalog.princeton.edu/catalog/9946307343506421 has items in "Forrestal Annex - Reserve" but bibdata is reporting `on_reserve = "N"`

```
{
    "9946307343506421": {
        "22685987520006421": {
            "on_reserve": "N",
            "location": "annex$reserve",
            "label": "Forrestal Annex - Reserve",
            "status_label": "Available",
            "copy_number": null,
            "cdl": false,
            "temp_location": false,
            "id": "22685987520006421"
        },
        ...
}
```
Annex$reserve is no longer a reserve location.
Do we have a test record that I can use to validate?
